verses.verse: And there was a great<WH1419> cry<WH6818> of the people<WH5971> and of their wives<WH802> against<WH413> their brothers<WH251> the Jews.<WH3064>
For there were that said,<WH559> We, our sons,<WH1121> and our daughters,<WH1323> are many:<WH7227> therefore we take<WH3947> up corn<WH1715> for them, that we may eat,<WH398> and live.<WH2421>
Some also there were that said,<WH559> We have mortgaged<WH6148> our lands,<WH7704> vineyards,<WH3754> and houses,<WH1004> that we might buy<WH3947> corn,<WH1715> because of the dearth.<WH7458>
There were also that said,<WH559> We have borrowed<WH3867> money<WH3701> for the king's<WH4428> tribute,<WH4060> and that on our lands<WH7704> and vineyards.<WH3754>

Yet now<WH6258> our flesh<WH1320> is as the flesh<WH1320> of our brothers,<WH251> our children<WH1121> as their children:<WH1121> and, see,<WH2009> we bring<WH3533> into bondage<WH3533> our sons<WH1121> and our daughters<WH1323> to be servants,<WH5650> and some of our daughters<WH1323> are brought<WH3533> to bondage<WH3533> already: neither<WH369> is it in our power<WH3027> to redeem them; for other<WH312> men<WH582> have our lands<WH7704> and vineyards.<WH3754>
And I was very<WH3966> angry<WH2734> when<WH834> I heard<WH8085> their cry<WH2201> and these<WH428> words.<WH1697>

Then I consulted<WH4427> with myself, and I rebuked<WH7378> the nobles,<WH2715> and the rulers,<WH5461> and said<WH559> to them, You exact<WH5378> usury,<WH5383> every<WH376> one<WH376> of his brother.<WH251> And I set<WH5414> a great<WH1419> assembly<WH6952> against<WH5921> them.

And I said<WH559> to them, We after<WH1767> our ability<WH1767> have redeemed<WH7069> our brothers<WH251> the Jews,<WH3064> which were sold<WH4376> to the heathen;<WH1471> and will you even<WH1571> sell<WH4376> your brothers?<WH251> or shall they be sold<WH4376> to us? Then held<WH2790> they their peace,<WH2790> and found<WH4672> nothing<WH3808> to answer.<WH1696>

Also I said,<WH559> It is not good<WH2896> that you do:<WH6213> ought you not to walk<WH3212> in the fear<WH3374> of our God<WH430> because of the reproach<WH2781> of the heathen<WH1471> our enemies?<WH341>

I likewise,<WH1571> and my brothers,<WH251> and my servants,<WH5288> might exact<WH5383> of them money<WH3701> and corn:<WH1715> I pray<WH4994> you, let us leave<WH5800> off this<WH2088> usury.<WH5383>

Restore,<WH7725> I pray<WH4994> you, to them, even this day,<WH3117> their lands,<WH7704> their vineyards,<WH3754> their olive groves,<WH2132> and their houses,<WH1004> also the hundredth<WH3967> part of the money,<WH3701> and of the corn,<WH1715> the wine,<WH8492> and the oil,<WH3323> that you exact<WH5383> of them.

Then said<WH559> they, We will restore<WH7725> them, and will require<WH1245> nothing<WH3808> of them; so<WH3651> will we do<WH6213> as you say.<WH559> Then I called<WH7121> the priests,<WH3548> and took an oath<WH7650> of them, that they should do<WH6213> according to this<WH2088> promise.<WH1697>

Also<WH1571> I shook<WH5287> my lap,<WH2684> and said,<WH559> So<WH3602> God<WH430> shake<WH5287> out every man<WH376> from his house,<WH1004> and from his labor,<WH3018> that performes<WH6965> not this<WH2088> promise,<WH1697> even<WH3602> thus<WH3602> be he shaken<WH5287> out, and emptied.<WH7386> And all<WH3605> the congregation<WH6951> said,<WH559> Amen,<WH543> and praised<WH1984> the LORD.<WH3068> And the people<WH5971> did<WH6213> according to this<WH2088> promise.<WH1697>

Moreover<WH1571> from the time<WH3117> that I was appointed<WH6680> to be their governor<WH6346> in the land<WH776> of Judah,<WH3063> from the twentieth<WH6242> year<WH8141> even to the two<WH8147> and thirtieth<WH7970> year<WH8141> of Artaxerxes<WH783> the king,<WH4428> that is, twelve<WH8147> <WH6240> years,<WH8141> I and my brothers<WH251> have not eaten<WH398> the bread<WH3899> of the governor.<WH6346>

But the former<WH7223> governors<WH6346> that had been before<WH6440> me were chargeable<WH3513> to the people,<WH5971> and had taken<WH3947> of them bread<WH3899> and wine,<WH3196> beside<WH310> forty<WH705> shekels<WH8255> of silver;<WH3701> yes,<WH1571> even their servants<WH5288> bore<WH7980> rule<WH7980> over<WH5921> the people:<WH5971> but so<WH3651> did<WH6213> not I, because<WH6440> of the fear<WH3374> of God.<WH430>

Yes,<WH1571> also<WH1571> I continued<WH2388> in the work<WH4399> of this<WH2063> wall,<WH2346> neither<WH3808> bought<WH7069> we any land:<WH7704> and all<WH3605> my servants<WH5288> were gathered<WH6908> thither<WH8033> to the work.<WH4399>

Moreover there were at<WH5921> my table<WH7979> an hundred<WH3967> and fifty<WH2572> of the Jews<WH3064> and rulers,<WH5461> beside those that came<WH935> to us from among<WH4480> the heathen<WH1471> that are about us.

Now that which<WH834> was prepared<WH6213> for me daily<WH3117> <WH259> was one<WH259> ox<WH7794> and six<WH8337> choice<WH1305> sheep;<WH6629> also fowls<WH6833> were prepared<WH6213> for me, and once<WH996> in ten<WH6235> days<WH3117> store<WH7235> of all<WH3605> sorts of wine:<WH3196> yet for all<WH5973> this<WH2088> required<WH1245> not I the bread<WH3899> of the governor,<WH6346> because<WH3588> the bondage<WH5656> was heavy<WH3513> on this<WH2088> people.<WH5971>
Think<WH2142> on me, my God,<WH430> for good,<WH2896> according to all<WH3605> that I have done<WH6213> for this<WH2088> people.<WH5971>
